src:
Kilang LNG Blok Masela akan Dibangun di Kepulauan Tanimbar
05 Nov 2019, 10:46 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Dok. SKK Migas

Jakarta - Kilang gas alam cair atau liquefied natural gas (LNG) Blok Masela akan dibangun di Kabupaten Kepulauan Tanimbar, Maluku. Hal tersebut ditandai dengan penyerahan Surat Permohonan Penetapan Lokasi dan Surat Rekomendasi Gubernur.Surat tersebut disampaikan oleh Kepala Satuan Kerja Khusus Pelaksana Kegiatan Hulu Minyak dan Gas Bumi (SKK Migas) Dwi Soetjipto ke Gubernur Maluku Irjend Polisi (Purn) Murad Ismail. Serta, disaksikan Presiden Inpex Akihiro Watabe dan Kepala DPRD Provinsi Maluku Lucki Wattimury kemarin (4/11/2019).Dalam sambutannya Murad mengatakan, Pemerintah Provinsi Maluku mendukung pembangunan proyek ini. Dia berharap, masyarakat akan mendapat manfaat dari pembangunan kilang.Lanjutnya, pemerintah daerah siap memberi dukungan berupa percepatan Amdal dan pengadaan lahan."Saya ingin tahun 2020 Amdal dan pengadaan lahan dapat selesai. Sehingga di tahun berikutnya kegiatan fisik sudah dapat dimulai. Harapannya produksi gas bumi dapat disegerakan," ujar Murad dalam keterangan tertulis, Selasa (5/11/2019).Dwi mengapresiasi dukungan pemerintah daerah yang mempercepat pengembangan Blok Masela. Dwi melanjutkan dalam pengembangan Blok Masela mesti memperhatikan tiga hal yakni kualitas, jadwal dan biaya."Kualitas penting karena LNG Plant yang dibangun akan dioperasikan untuk waktu lama, sampai dengan tahun 2055. Schedule itu juga penting, karena semakin cepat selesai maka hasilnya akan cepat kita nikmati, baik oleh Pemerintah Pusat maupun Pemda dan masyarakat sekitar. Namun demikian untuk melakukan keduanya tetap harus memperhatikan cost atau biaya. Harus menggunakan biaya yang efisien," jelasnya. Simak Video "Jokowi Minta Konten dan Pekerja Lokal Diberdayakan di Blok Masela"[Gambas:Video 20detik](ara/ara)
text:
The Masela Block LNG Plant will be Built in the Tanimbar Islands
05 Nov 2019, 10:46 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Doc. SKK Migas

Jakarta - The Masela Block liquefied natural gas (LNG) refinery will be built in Tanimbar Islands Regency, Maluku. This was marked by the submission of the Application for Location Determination and the Governor's Recommendation Letter. The letter was submitted by the Head of the Special Task Force for Upstream Oil and Gas Activities (SKK Migas) Dwi Soetjipto to the Maluku Governor Police Irjend Murad Ismail. Also, witnessed by Inpex President Akihiro Watabe and Head of Maluku Provincial DPRD Lucki Wattimury yesterday (4/11/2019). In his remarks Murad said, the Maluku Provincial Government supported the development of this project. He hopes that the community will benefit from the construction of the refinery. Furthermore, the regional government is ready to provide support in the form of accelerating Environmental Impact Assessments and land acquisition. "I want 2020 Environmental Impact Assessment and land acquisition to be completed. So that in the following year physical activities can begin. Hopefully gas production the earth can be hastened, "Murad said in a written statement, Tuesday (11/5/2019). Two appreciated the support of the regional government which accelerated the development of the Masela Block. Dwi continued in developing the Masela Block that must pay attention to three things namely quality, schedule and cost. "Quality is important because the LNG Plant that is built will be operated for a long time, until 2055. The schedule is also important, because the sooner it is completed the results will be faster we enjoy, both by the Central Government and the Regional Government and the surrounding community. However, to do both, they must pay attention to costs or costs. Must use cost efficiently, "he explained. Check out the video "Jokowi Asks for Content and Local Workers to Be Empowered in the Masela Block" [Gambas: Video 20seconds] (fig / fig)
